channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11349] [Thrift] support authentication/impersonation
item.description: Thrift server can access HBase as a fixed authenticated user. However, we don't authenticate thrift clients. It will be great if the thrift server can authenticate clients, and support impersonation.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Great! It's a important feature our users are looking for.
Attached a patch for thrift1. I will work on a patch for thrift2 in a different jira.

The patch did some refactory to the REST server impersonation support. So that we can share the logic in Thrift. For Thrift, you need to configure "hbase.thrift.security.qop" to either auth-conf, auth-int, or auth to enable authentication/impersonation. The previous running modes work the same as before.
The patch is also on RB: https://reviews.apache.org/r/22987/

The patch did some refactory to the REST server impersonation support. So that we can share the logic in Thrift.

Skimmed patch. That part lgtm.
Thanks. I will enhance a patch a little so that we can cache the effective user instead of creating a new one for each call.
Attached v2 that creates a proxy user object only when needed.
Patch v2.1 missed one getUserFromPrincipal. I can fix it at commit.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12654618/hbase-11349_v2.1.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12654618

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 4 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .
